str2: No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
Abraham, progenitor of the Hebrew race. Of Hebrew origin; Abraham, the Hebrew patriarch.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From dikaios; to render just or innocent.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From ana and phero; to take up.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
(Hebrew), Isaac, the patriarch. Of Hebrew origin; Isaac, the son of Abraham.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An altar (for sacrifice). From a derivative of thusia; a place of sacrifice, i.e. An altar.
